subject: Re: how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: ... Yes.  I mention it in my book, but mainly so readers will know what it is when they see it... I go on to give the canonical way to test for exceptions:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> >So said Lucas on 2003-05-22 --------------------
> >import junit.extensions.ExceptionTestCase;

> I don't think anyone uses ExceptionTestCase. Kent himself said that he
> regrets creating it.

Yes. I mention it in my book, but mainly so readers will know what it
is when they see it... I go on to give the canonical way to test for
exceptions:

public void testForException() {
try {
doSomethingThatShouldThrowMyException();
fail("MyException not thrown");
} catch (MyException ex) {
}
}

Dave
